etymology.description: 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand") as semantic indicating action + 詹(詹) (zhān, "prolong") as phonetic -> hand action of carrying -> 擔(擔) (dān, "to carry on the shoulder")
etymology.interpretation: The character 擔 is composed of 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand") to signify a hand action and 詹(詹) (zhān) for its phonetic contribution, illustrating the idea of carrying something on one's shoulder with both hands.
etymology.simplification: The traditional character 擔 was simplified by reducing the complexity of its components, specifically merging 扌(手) with a simplified variant of 詹(詹).

examples.chinese: 他担着沉重的木材(他擔著沉重的木材)，走向工地(走向工地)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dān zhe chén zhòng de mù cái, zǒu xiàng gōng dì.
examples.english: He is carrying heavy wood and heading to the construction site.

examples.chinese: 农夫担着谷物(農夫擔著穀物)，赶往市场(趕往市場)。
examples.pinyin: Nóng fū dān zhe gǔ wù, gǎn wǎng shì chǎng.
examples.english: The farmer is carrying grains and hurrying to the market.
